{"id":1818243005,"question_id":4037,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 weeks, 2 days","timestamp":1762054039,"status":12,"status_display":"Memory Limit Exceeded","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1818243005/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Lexicographically Smallest Palindromic Permutation Greater Than Target","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution:\n    def lexPalindromicPermutation(self, s: str, target: str) -> str:\n        cnt = defaultdict(lambda: 0)\n        for c in s:\n            cnt[c] += 1\n\n        odds = []\n        for k, v in cnt.items():\n            if v % 2 == 1:\n                odds.append(k)\n        if len(odds) > 1:\n            return \"\"\n\n        for k in [i for i in cnt]:\n            cnt[k] //= 2\n\n        def full(val):\n            if len(s) % 2 == 0:\n                return val + val[::-1]\n            else:\n                return val + odds[0] + val[::-1]\n\n        ans = \"\"\n\n        @cache\n        def dfs(i, pref):\n            nonlocal ans\n            f = full(pref)\n            if len(f) == len(target) and f > target:\n                ans = min(ans, f) if ans != \"\" else f\n                return\n\n            for k in cnt:\n                if cnt[k] <= 0 or pref + k < target[:len(pref) + 1]:\n                    continue\n                \n                cnt[k] -= 1\n                dfs(i+1, pref + k)\n                cnt[k] += 1\n\n        dfs(0, \"\")\n        return ans if ans > target else \"\"\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"lexicographically-smallest-palindromic-permutation-greater-than-target","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1,"frontend_id":1339}
